p: Mono-cultivar extra-virgin olive oils come from four varieties of olives typical of Tuscany: Frantoio, Leccino, Moraiolo, and Pendolino, harvested at the end of October/beginning of November of 2015. These samples were provided by private producer companies in the coast area of Tuscany (LI, Livorno) [ 38]; some of them were stored at room temperature (≤22 °C) and in the dark, while others were stored in a refrigerator at a temperature of 4 °C (see Table 1). Olive oils made from a blend of cultivars were produced in 2012 or in 2015; they were stored in the dark at temperatures indicated in Table 1. Labels of different EVOO and VOO samples are also shown in Table 1.
